name: SimulatorHits Website
description: SimulatorHits is an Online Radio Station aimed for listeners that are into gaming mainly simulation games. I have been a developer here for many years now and I have worked on the website during this time. We started to make the site using Laravel which is a PHP Framework. Now we have changed to use Laravel as the backend of the site and use Next.JS for the frontend. The radio panel for staff has also been made using Laravel and allows staff to read requests when live on the station, add banners, manage users, etc....

name: SimulatorHits App
description: SimulatorHits is an Online Radio Station aimed for listeners that are into gaming mainly simulation games. I have been a developer here for many years now and I have just release version 2 of the mobile app. The mobile app is made in Flutter which is a cross-platform framework that compiles down to native code so it can run on a range of operating systems. This app targets IOS and Android and includes features such as the player, show timetable and a requests form. Unfortunately, this app has been taken down however, plans are to get it back up in the future!

name: TruckStopRadio App
description: TruckStopRadio is a fully community-ran, online radio station for the Simulation community that launched on the 12th May 2020. I was brought in to develop a mobile app to increase community outreach and needs. The mobile app is made in Flutter which is a cross-platform framework that compiles down to native code so it can run on a range of operating systems. This app targets IOS and Android and includes features such as the player and a show timetable. Across both platforms, the app has been downloaded close to 1000 times.

name: VTC Gateway
description: VTC Gateway is a platform to allow Virtual Trucking Companies' (VTC) for Euro Truck Simulator 2 and American Truck Simulator to have an in-house like drivers hub so their drivers can track their jobs and progress within their VTC. We have found a niche where other platforms are not open to friend groups which is what we are offering along with VTC plans. This is made with a Django backend and a Next.JS frontend. I am the founder of this platform and we are hopefully releasing in March!

name: TrackSim Tracker
description: TrackSim is a platform that allows drivers to get statistics and information from Euro Truck Simulator 2 and American Truck Simulator. I have been brought in to make a better tracker that doesn't use shared memory as the current solution uses python and it cannot keep up with the speed of which data gets sent to it from the game. I am solving this by making the tracker in c++ and utilising many libraries like CURL, SteamworksSDK, SCS SDK, etc... to solve this.

name: OceanDrive
description: OceanDrive is a FiveM server which is a modded Grand Theft Auto V online mod that allows players to join servers but also allows developers to make scripts using web technologies like HTML, CSS and javascript with scripts utilising Lua or C# as the backend to communicate with the database. We have an active dev team and my role is to help fix bugs mainly in JavaScript however I have helped with creating custom scripts.

name: Howietoun Heritage
description: This was a website I helped create using WordPress for The Howietoun Heritage and Nature Sanctuary Charitable Trust. I worked closely with the client to try and bring their vision alive and this could be achieved with my experience working on websites and being able to learn and adapt quickly to new technologies. Wordpress was difficult to work with due to my main focus being custom sites using programming languages and web technologies.

name: Oops I Forget!
description: This was my dissertation project for my Bachelors @ Stirling University. The app was aimed at students to help them manage their time. I used Flutter as the framework to make this with due to it being a new and upcoming technology for cross-platform mobile app development. I was able to link this with Firebase as the backend which is a NoSQL database that has pre-made features to make prototyping easier. I hope to complete this project in the near future.

name: University of Stirling Society of Computing
description: I was one of the committee members that regenerated the society after it stopping for a few years. I was able to develop a Laravel site that allowed members of the university to have a look at what the society is all about and allowed committee members to add information about themselves, edit content on the site to make it easy to update the information on the site, etc... The site is now being changed by the current committee however I have linked my version of the site.
